subject_terms_3: Blue and white ware China Decorative arts Ceramics
context_2: It was exhibited at the Exhibition of Chinese Blue-and-White Ceramics held at the National Museum of Singapore in 1978.

physical_appearance: "This is a Qing dynasty dish and its interior is decorated with the ""China aster"" pattern. While the outer rim consists of repeated asters divided by a thin free-handed stroke
title_text: Blue and white dish with aster pattern
creation_date: Qing dynasty, late 17th or early 18th century
subject_terms_1: the center of the dish is comprised of five aster flower heads surrounded by repeated swirl motifs. A leaf motif as well as three stickers and its accession number can be found on the underside of the dish. " symbolism  floral patterns  stamps (marks)
